of Veterans Affairs to provide for the conduct

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Clay Hunt Suicide Prevention for American Veterans Act

header.#text:
Evaluation of mental health care and suicide prevention programs of Department of Veterans Affairs
			 and Department of Defense

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
concerned shall provide for the conduct of
			 an evaluation of the mental health care and suicide prevention programs
			 carried out under the laws administered by such

text.#text: The
Each evaluation conducted under paragraph (1) shall—

use metrics that are common among and useful for practitioners in the field of mental health care
			 and suicide prevention;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
concerned, including such programs conducted at a Center of
			 Excellence;

text.#text:
evaluate the effectiveness of each mental health care and suicide prevention program conducted by
			 the
identify the most effective and least effective of the programs evaluated under subparagraph (B);

include recommendations on which programs evaluated under subparagraph (B) can be eliminated or
			 consolidated and which programs can benefit from additional resources; and

propose best practices for caring for individuals who suffer from mental health disorders or are at
			 risk of suicide.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and the

text.#text:
Each evaluation provided for under paragraph (1) shall be conducted by an independent third party
			 unaffiliated with the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
concerned the evaluation of the mental health care
			 and suicide prevention programs carried out under the laws administered by
			 such

text.#text:
An independent third party that conducts an evaluation provided for under paragraph (1) shall
			 submit to the

concerned shall
			 submit to the appropriate committees of

a report that contains
			 the evaluation submitted to the
under paragraph (3)(B).

header.#text:
Pilot program for repayment of educational loans for certain psychiatrists of Veterans Health
			 Administration

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall carry out a pilot program to repay loans of individuals
			 described in subsection (b) that—

text.#text: The

were used by such individuals to finance the educational expenses of such individuals relating to
			 psychiatric medicine, including
			 education leading to—
an undergraduate degree;
a degree of doctor of medicine; or
a degree of doctor of osteopathy; and
were obtained from any of the following:
A governmental entity.
A private financial institution.
An institution of higher education.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: for purposes of the pilot program.

text.#text: Any other entity as specified the

Subject to paragraph (2), an individual eligible for participation in the pilot program is an
			 individual who—
either—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: ; or
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Veterans Health
			 Administration of the Department of Veterans Affairs

text.#text: is licensed or eligible for licensure to practice psychiatric medicine in the

is enrolled in the final year of a residency program leading to a specialty qualification in
			 psychiatric medicine that is approved by the Accreditation Council for
			 Graduate Medical Education; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , as determined by the

text.#text: demonstrates a commitment to a long-term career as a psychiatrist in the

An individual who is participating in any other program of the Federal Government that repays the
			 educational loans of the individual is not eligible to participate in the
			 pilot program.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall select not less than 10 individuals described in subsection (b) to participate
			 in the pilot program for each year in which the

carries out the
			 pilot program.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall enter into an agreement with each individual selected under subsection (c) in
			 which such individual agrees to serve a period of obligated service for
			 the

in the field of psychiatric medicine,
			 as determined by the

for purposes of the pilot program, in
			 exchange for the repayment of the loan or loans of such individual under
			 the pilot program.

text.#text: The

Subject to paragraph (2), a loan repayment under this section may consist of payment of the
			 principal, interest, and related expenses of a loan obtained by an
			 individual who is participating in the pilot program for all educational
			 expenses (including tuition, fees, books, and laboratory expenses) of such
			 individual relating to education described in subsection (a)(1).

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may pay not more than
			 $120,000 in loan repayment on behalf of such individual.

text.#text:
For each year of obligated service that an individual who is participating in the pilot program
			 agrees to serve under subsection (d), the

An individual who participates in the pilot program and fails to satisfy the period of obligated
			 service under subsection (d) shall be liable to the United States, in lieu
			 of such obligated service, for the amount that has been paid or is payable
			 to or on behalf of the individual under the pilot program, reduced by the
			 proportion that the number of days served for completion of the period of
			 obligated service bears to the total number of days in the period of
			 obligated service of such individual.

Any amount of damages that the United States is entitled to recover under this subsection shall be
			 paid to the United States not later than one year after the date of the
			 breach of the agreement.

header.#text:
Collaboration on suicide prevention efforts between the Department of Veterans Affairs and
			 non-profit mental health organizations

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may collaborate with non-profit mental health organizations to
			 prevent suicide among veterans as follows:

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and non-profit mental health organizations.

text.#text: To improve the efficiency and effectiveness of suicide prevention efforts carried out by the

To assist non-profit mental health organizations with the suicide prevention efforts of those
			 organizations through the use of the expertise of employees of the
To jointly carry out suicide prevention efforts.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
and any non-profit mental
			 health organization with which the

is collaborating under such
			 subsection  shall exchange training sessions, best practices, and other
			 resources to help with the suicide prevention efforts of the Department
			 and such organization.

text.#text: In carrying out any collaboration under subsection (a), the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall select within the

a Director of Suicide Prevention Coordination to
			 undertake any collaboration with non-profit mental health organizations
			 under this section or any other provision of law.
